content:
What should our process be for change records in issues like https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4985 ...I personally think that if we can get a change record created before we merge changes, or at about the same time, then that would be ideal, but if that is not the case should we:

  • keep the issue open and add the "needs - change record" label to it
  • open a follow-up issue for the change record

...if we do new issues, should they be created under https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues or https://github.com/backdrop-ops/docs.backdropcms.org/issues?

I think process is add 'fixed' label to issue, but leave open with 'change record' label too.
Same issue means you don't have to go hunting for the info when you're writing the change record.
